results.title: M*A*S*H = Mash (Special edition) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Robert Altman, Leon Ericksen, Ingo Preminger, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Aspen Productions
results.brief_description: Hailed as one of the best comedies ever made. Army surgeons during the Korean war develop a lunatic life-style in order to cope with the everyday horrors encountered in a Mobile Army Surgical Hospital. The film mixes slap-stick with tragedy and pokes merciless fun at military pomposity, empty religion and incompetence. It sticks its tongue out at hypocrisy - the same attitudes which made the spin-off television series highly successful. Based on a novel by Richard Hooker.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Altman, Leon Ericksen, Ingo Preminger, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Aspen Productions

results.title: M Comme Mathieu = M as in Mathieu
results.brief_description:
Mathieu is just out of a convalescing home and resumes life at home with wife Jeanne. His mental health is still unstable and he cannot control his obsession for Muriel, an imaginary woman who looks just like Jeanne.

Credits: Producer, Bob Zagury ; director, Jean-Francois Adam ; writer, Jean-Francois Adam ; photography, Pierre Lhomme ; music, Antoine Duhamel.
Cast: Sami Frey, Brigitte Fossey, Roland Dubillard, Bulle Ogier, Laurent Mirouze.

results.title: M'eza (preview for an interactive installation)
results.creator_credit: Advanced Diploma of Multimedia (ADoM), Swinburne University of Technology (formerly Electronic Design and Interactive Media (EDIM) and Anita Bacic
results.brief_description: As part of the end of year screening for the Swinburne, EDIM (Electronic Design and Interactive Media) course - those students who had completed interactive coursework were required to create a linear representation of their work for the showreel. M’eza is an immersive art-piece screened at Videobrasil Electronic Art festival 2003. Artist should be contacted at a later date for a further explanation of the work

results.title: Lyrebird: master of mimicry
results.brief_description: Lyrebirds in Sherbrooke Forest in the Dandenong Ranges, Victoria. Shows the lyrebirds displaying their powers of mimicry - the sounds they emit are extremely varied and cover a large vocal range. Few animals call for such a long period. They imitate all the other birds of the forest, the whip bird, kookaburra, a flock of rosellas and many others. Also includes their own distinctive calls and dance.

results.title: Lyn McLain
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
Lyn McLain is the founder and director of the District of Columbia Youth Symphony Orchestra, one of the most extraordinary musical groups in the United States. It is made up of children, aged from eight to seventeen years, from all walks of life, who voluntarily give up their Saturdays to study music.

results.title: Luz
results.brief_description: 128…129…129…a walk through a wondrous neighbourhood that only a child could imagine. A little girl plays in the street while her mother calls her home, wherever we find it.

results.title: Luxembourg
results.brief_description: Brief travelogue describing Luxembourg, capital of the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg. Shows typical street scenes, the market in the main square - the Place Guillaume, the Palace of the Grand Duchess and nearby Mondorf-les-Bains famous for its spa waters, the Caisse d’Epargne, the famous bridge - the Pont Adolphe.

results.title: Luther Metke at 94
results.creator_credit: Steve Raymen, Jorge Preloran, Richard Hawkins and Ethnographic Film Program
results.brief_description: A portrait of Luther Metke who has lived in this Cascade Mountains of Oregon since 1907. Tells how he was a veteran of the Spanish American War, an early labor organiser, a poet, and a builder, and today serves as a vital and lucid example of the rural ethic in America.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steve Raymen, Jorge Preloran, Richard Hawkins and Ethnographic Film Program
